body.origin: |- diffsc(hs1, c2)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crg), wb(wcel(c1, cfv(csubrg, c0)), wa(wcel(c1, cfv(csubg, c0)), wcel(c1, cfv(csubmnd, c2)))))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(cmgp, c0))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ Ring →(c1 ∈(SubRing ` c0)↔(c1 ∈(SubGrp ` c0)∧ c1 ∈(SubMnd ` c2))))
⊣ c2 =(mulGrp ` c0)

comment: A subring is an additive subgroup which is also a multiplicative submonoid. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Mar-2015.)
